snippet: Gov. Walker and leaders in Wisconsin’s Republican-held Legislature are pushing the University of Wisconsin system to give a board largely picked by the governor far more control over firings and even curriculum.
abstract: Wisconsin Gov Scott Walker, who is set to enter race for Republican presidential nomination, is pushing for greater control over University of Wisconsin's curriculum and system of tenure; along with Republican-led Legislature, Walker is calling for board largely picked by governor to oversee such control, move critics say is an effort to burnish his conservative credentials.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and TAMAR LEWIN
byline.contributor: Monica Davey reported from Chicago, and Tamar Lewin from New York. Dirk Johnson contributed reporting from Madison, Wis.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Walker and leaders in Wisconsin’s Republican-held Legislature are pushing the University of Wisconsin system to give a board largely picked by the governor far more control over firings and even curriculum.

headline.main: Unions Subdued, Scott Walker Turns to Tenure at Wisconsin Colleges
headline.print_headline: Unions Subdued, Walker Turns to Tenure at Wisconsin Colleges
